docs.lead_paragraph: Speaker John A. Boehner’s resignation is likely to herald an even more combative stretch in Washington, emboldening conservatives to defy President Obama on spending, debt and taxes.

headline.main: The Post-Boehner Congress and Washington’s Sense of Dread
headline.print_headline: The Post-Boehner Congress and Washington’s Sense of Dread

docs.abstract: Resignation of Rep John Boehner as House speaker has raised fears that already combative political situation in Congress will worsen; some say Boehner's demise will pressure his successor to further defy Obama administration policies and programs.
docs.snippet: Speaker John A. Boehner’s resignation is likely to herald an even more combative stretch in Washington, emboldening conservatives to defy President Obama on spending, debt and taxes.

byline.original: By JONATHAN WEISMAN and MICHAEL D. SHEAR

docs.lead_paragraph: Unpaid caregivers provide 90 percent of long-term care for the old or disabled, for those lucky enough to have someone.

headline.main: The Fragile Patchwork of Care for New York’s Oldest Old

docs.abstract: John Sorensen, Helen Moses and Frederick Jones are among New York City residents over age of 85 who rely on friends and family, rather than paid professionals, for care; such arrangements can be costly to caregivers in terms of time and money (Series: 85 and Up).
docs.snippet: Unpaid caregivers provide 90 percent of long-term care for the old or disabled, for those lucky enough to have someone.

docs.lead_paragraph: It’s simple: All Ashkenazi Jewish women should have the BRCA test.

headline.main: The Breast Cancer Gene and Me
headline.print_headline: The Breast Cancer Gene and Me

docs.abstract: Op-Ed article by Elizabeth Wurtzel reflects on how she was blindsided by being diagnosed with breast cancer; notes she has BRCA mutation, as do many of her fellow Ashkenazi Jews, and notes that most insurers do not pay for screening for mutation unless patient meets specific requirements; calls on insurers to cover BRCA testing for all Ashkenazi Jewish women, given their increased risk.
docs.snippet: It’s simple: All Ashkenazi Jewish women should have the BRCA test.

docs.lead_paragraph: The patient was unconscious and ready for surgery, but the doctor was not in.

headline.main: Fraud Case Alleges Hundreds of Surgeries by Non-Doctor
headline.print_headline: Fraud Case Alleges Hundreds of Surgeries by Non-Doctor

docs.snippet: The patient was unconscious and ready for surgery, but the doctor was not in.

docs.lead_paragraph: State authorities said on Friday that the cooperative, a nonprofit insurer, must stop writing new policies, citing the likelihood that it would become insolvent.

headline.main: New York State Orders Health Republic Co-op to End New Business
headline.print_headline: Insurer Given Order to End New Business

docs.abstract: New York State authorities order nonprofit insurance cooperative Health Republic to dissolve its business after open policies expire and nonprofit ceases writing new policies, citing likelihood that cooperative will become financially insolvent.
docs.snippet: State authorities said on Friday that the cooperative, a nonprofit insurer, must stop writing new policies, citing the likelihood that it would become insolvent.

keywords.value: Health Republic Insurance of New York
keywords.name: organizations

docs.lead_paragraph: Stephen J. Ubl is known in Washington for his deep knowledge of health policy, shrewd political instincts and low-key manner.

headline.main: Drug Companies Hire New Lobbyist to Answer Critics
headline.print_headline: Drug Companies Bring On a New Lobbyist

docs.abstract: Stephen J Ubl is appointed president and chief executive of Pharmaceutical Research and Manufacturers of America, becoming top lobbyist defending drug industry against charges that pharmaceutical companies charge too much for medicines.
docs.snippet: Stephen J. Ubl is known in Washington for his deep knowledge of health policy, shrewd political instincts and low-key manner.

keywords.value: Pharmaceutical Research and Manufacturers of America
keywords.name: organizations

docs.lead_paragraph: G.D.P. rose faster in the spring than previously estimated, the government said. Nike jumped after its results easily beat analysts’ expectations.

headline.main: Market Mixed Despite an Encouraging Report on Growth
headline.print_headline: Health Sector Is Latest to Unnerve Investors

docs.abstract: Falling health care stocks drag market down.

docs.lead_paragraph: Despite gains in the number of Americans with health insurance, employers are continuing to shift costs to workers in the form of higher deductibles.

headline.main: How to Manage Increasingly Higher Medical Deductibles

docs.abstract: Ann Carrns Your Money Adviser column says Kaiser Family Foundation analysis finds more workers have general annual health insurance deductibles, and 2015 average is more than $1,300 for single person; questions and answers provided on managing personal medical costs.
docs.snippet: Despite gains in the number of Americans with health insurance, employers are continuing to shift costs to workers in the form of higher deductibles.

keywords.value: Patient Protection and Affordable Care Act (2010)
keywords.name: subject

docs.lead_paragraph: Efforts to hold together a merged congregation raise the question of whether the Roman Catholic Church can minister to New York City’s poor in an era of diminishing resources.

headline.main: In the Bronx, ‘Poor Church’ Is More Than a Papal Phrase
headline.print_headline: In This Parish, ‘Poor Church’ Is the Reality

docs.abstract: July closing of St Joseph's Church in the Bronx has left Rev Nelson A Belizario with challenge of trying to ensure that former parishioners of St Joseph’s do not leave the Catholic fold; New York Archdiocese merged St Joseph's with Belizario's St Simon Stock following closure, leaving many parishioners with sense of bitterness.
docs.snippet: Efforts to hold together a merged congregation raise the question of whether the Roman Catholic Church can minister to New York City’s poor in an era of diminishing resources.

docs.lead_paragraph: The man accused of attempting to drown his three children in a pond was dismissed from a mental health center because he didn't have insurance, his brother said Friday.

headline.main: Man: Brother Sent From Treatment Before Attempted Drownings
headline.print_headline: Man: Brother Sent From Treatment Before Attempted Drownings

docs.snippet: The man accused of attempting to drown his three children in a pond was dismissed from a mental health center because he didn't have insurance, his brother said Friday.
